message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CE 

The paper presents a data-driven method for fault detection and root cause analysis in complex systems, specifically industrial chemical processing plants. The method involves the use of transfer entropy estimation and eigenvector centrality analysis to infer a weighted directed graph of process elements and rank them according to their overall effect. This approach falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY) as it deals with monitoring and controlling complex systems. Additionally, the use of data-driven methods and machine learning techniques such as transfer entropy and eigenvector centrality analysis suggests that the paper could also be classified under artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). Finally, the application of the proposed method to industrial chemical processing plants suggests that the paper could also be classified under computational engineering, finance, and science (cs.CE).
